docs.lead_paragraph: Justus Uwayesu’s life was changed by a chance encounter in Rwanda with an American charity worker.

headline.main: From a Rwandan Dump to the Halls of Harvard
headline.print_headline: From a Rwandan Dump to the Halls of Harvard

docs.abstract: Justus Uwayesu, rescued by American charity worker Clare Effiong at age 9 from streets of Rwanda, is enrolled as a freshman at Harvard University on a full scholarship; as a student in Rwanda, Uwayesu learned English, French, Swahili and Lingala, oversaw his high school's student tutoring program and helped found youth charity that spread to high schools nationwide, buying health insurance for poor students and giving medical and scholastic aid to others.
docs.snippet: Justus Uwayesu’s life was changed by a chance encounter in Rwanda with an American charity worker.

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: Many established spas and retreats are retooling their offerings to attract the same target: wealthy, successful and highly stressed-out executives.

headline.seo: Health Spas Aimed at Teaching Stressed Executives to Unwind

docs.abstract: Many established spas and retreats have turned their focus to fitness in effort to appeal to wealthy, highly stressed-out executives; VeraVia in California charges $1,000 roughly a day for its services, which include sessions with nutritionists, physical activities, massages and much more.
docs.snippet: Many established spas and retreats are retooling their offerings to attract the same target: wealthy, successful and highly stressed-out executives.

docs.lead_paragraph: Thanks to gains made in their generation, and to demographic factors, many women now nearing retirement age control substantial assets.

headline.main: Older Women and Challenges of Wealth
headline.print_headline: Older Women and Challenges of Wealth

docs.abstract: Many women close to retirement age, as result of gains made in their generation and demographic factors, have substantial assets; advice on how they should prepare for long term retirement offered.
docs.snippet: Thanks to gains made in their generation, and to demographic factors, many women now nearing retirement age control substantial assets.

docs.lead_paragraph: Financial advisers say investment portfolios, financial plans and lifestyles can be adjusted to limit the risk of running out of money before you run out of time.

headline.main: Making Sure Retirement Savings Don’t Run Out
headline.print_headline: Making Sure Retirement Savings Don’t Run Out

docs.abstract: Financial advisers suggest ways that people can adjust their investment portfolios, financial plans and lifestyles to limit risk of running out of money during retirement years.
docs.snippet: Financial advisers say investment portfolios, financial plans and lifestyles can be adjusted to limit the risk of running out of money before you run out of time.

docs.lead_paragraph: Conceived at the World Wildlife Fund, the initiative uses bulk purchasing power to allow for discounts on home systems.

headline.main: Home Solar Power Discounts Are Worker Perk in New Program
headline.print_headline: Solar Energy Discounts Are Worker Perk in New Program

docs.abstract: Cisco System, 3M, Kimberly-Clark and National Geographic announce arrangement that will allow their employees to buy or lease solar systems for their homes at rates substantially lower than national average; program, called Solar Community Initiative and offered through Geostellar, aims to use bulk buying power of employees to allow for discounts on home systems.
docs.snippet: Conceived at the World Wildlife Fund, the initiative uses bulk purchasing power to allow for discounts on home systems.

docs.lead_paragraph: A father and son who ran New York City substance abuse clinics were accused on Wednesday of stealing tax money meant to treat addicts and using it to fund a lavish lifestyle that included luxury cars.

headline.main: Father, Son Who Ran NY Drug Treatment Centers Face Fraud Charges
headline.print_headline: Father, Son Who Ran NY Drug Treatment Centers Face Fraud Charges

docs.snippet: A father and son who ran New York City substance abuse clinics were accused on Wednesday of stealing tax money meant to treat addicts and using it to fund a lavish lifestyle that included luxury cars.

docs.lead_paragraph: Bob Pack wanted to go after the HMO doctors for recklessly prescribing painkillers to a drug-abusing nanny who ran over his 10-year-old son and 7-year-old daughter as they were heading for ice cream one early fall evening in 2003.

headline.main: California Malpractice Cap Generates Big Spending
headline.print_headline: California Malpractice Cap Generates Big Spending

docs.snippet: Bob Pack wanted to go after the HMO doctors for recklessly prescribing painkillers to a drug-abusing nanny who ran over his 10-year-old son and 7-year-old daughter as they were heading for ice cream one early fall evening in 2003.

docs.lead_paragraph: Oregon is cutting its last ties with a botched health insurance exchange portal built by Oracle Corp. as the state and the high-tech company pursue lawsuits against each other.

headline.main: Oregon Cuts Ties With Oracle's Health Exchange
headline.print_headline: Oregon Cuts Ties With Oracle's Health Exchange

docs.snippet: Oregon is cutting its last ties with a botched health insurance exchange portal built by Oracle Corp. as the state and the high-tech company pursue lawsuits against each other.

docs.lead_paragraph: As the damages wrought by increasingly disruptive weather patterns have climbed around the world, the insurance industry seems to have quietly engaged in what looks a lot like a retreat.
docs.abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column; damages wrought by increasingly disruptive weather patterns have climbed around the world, and as result the insurance industry seems to have quietly engaged in what looks a lot like a retreat; Swiss Re reports in 2013 that less than third of $116 billion in worldwide losses from weather-related disasters were covered by insurance.
docs.snippet: As the damages wrought by increasingly disruptive weather patterns have climbed around the world, the insurance industry seems to have quietly engaged in what looks a lot like a retreat.
